etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in William T. Brande (1788–1866), chemist. From myrist- (in scientific Latin myristica) + -in

definitions: A whitish solid triglyceride occurring in many vegetable fats and oils, especially the fixed oil of nutmeg and coconut oil; glyceryl trimyristate, (C₁₃ H₂₇ COO)₃ C₃ H₅.
